{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=2009 |Team=Florida State Seminoles |Image= FSU text logo.svg |ImageSize=125px |Conference=Atlantic Coast Conference |Division=Atlantic Division |ShortConference=ACC |CoachRank= |APRank= |BCSRank= |Record=7â6 |ConfRecord=4â4 |HeadCoach=[[Bobby Bowden]] |OffCoach=[[Jimbo Fisher]] |DefCoach=[[Mickey Andrews]] |OScheme=[[Pro Style]] |DScheme=[[4-3]] |StadiumArena=[[Bobby Bowden Field at Doak Campbell Stadium|Doak Campbell Stadium]] |Champion=Gator Bowl Champions |BowlTourney= [[2010 Gator Bowl|Gator Bowl]] vs. [[2009 West Virginia Mountaineers football team|West Virginia]] |BowlTourneyResult= W 33â21 |uniform=File:ACC-Uniform-FSU-2009.png }} {{2009 ACC football standings}} The '''2009 [[Florida State University Seminoles|Florida State Seminoles]] [[American football|football]] team''' represented [[Florida State University]] during the [[2009 NCAA Division I-BS football season|2009 college football season]]. The Seminoles were led by 34th year head coach [[Bobby Bowden]]. The Seminoles finished the season 7â6, 4â4 in [[2009 ACC football season|ACC]] play and won the [[2010 Gator Bowl|Gator Bowl]] 33â21 over [[2009 West Virginia Mountaineers football team|West Virginia]]. Head coach Bobby Bowden was forced to step down as coach at the end of the regular season but did coach the team in the Gator Bowl. Offensive Coordinator [[Jimbo Fisher]] will take over as head coach starting in the 2010 season. ==Previous Season== Florida State entered the 2009 season coming off a [[2008 Florida State Seminoles football team|2008]] season that ended with a 9-4 record (5-3 in the [[Atlantic Coast Conference]]) and a [[2008 Champs Sports Bowl|Champs Sports Bowl]] victory over [[2008 Wisconsin Badgers football team|Wisconsin]]. Florida State also won a share of the ACC Atlantic Division, but due to the head-to-head record versus [[2008 Boston College Eagles football team|Boston College]], the Eagles represented the Atlantic Division in the [[2008 ACC Championship Game|Championship Game]] held in [[Tampa, Florida|Tampa]]. ==Rankings== {{See also|2009 NCAA Division I FBS football rankings}} {| class="wikitable" style="white-space:nowrap;" |+ Ranking Movement
